page.title: 07Smooth skinned snake
page.content: The smooth skinned snake is a close relative of the grass snake. The smooth skinned snake's upper side is grey,brown or reddish with small black,brown or red spots,which often are in pairs,although sometimes are arranged in stripes.It normally grows to a length of about 18 inches.The smooth skinned snake mates after emerging from hibernation and then looks after the eggs until they are ready to hatch(about the end of August). The smooth skinned snake can be found within this D block,basking on the southern facing slopes.It feeds mainly on lizards(also common in this area)but it also eats young snakes and slow worms and occasionally mice and voles.
